forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind around 9 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 8 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city awakens to the gentle touch of a cool breeze amidst the remnants of a partly cloudy night. The temperature rests comfortably in the low fiftys, heralding a day promising clarity and warmth, although the gentle caress of the southwest wind hints at the ever-present marine influence. The forecast beckons sunshine to illuminate the streets, nudging temperatures up to the mid-sixties by midday, only to settle slightly as afternoon shadows lengthen.

Although the horizon may suggest a veil of fog clinging to the fringes of the Golden Gate—an ethereal reminder of the sea—it is unlikely to envelop the city itself today. Instead, expect an expansive blue sky to unfold, inviting exploration. A light layer, perhaps a cardigan or a thin jacket, will serve well against the brisk wind, which may dance playfully with the hair. With these conditions, it’s an ideal day for a leisurely walk through the vibrant streets of Chinatown or to find solace in one of the city’s many parks. Perhaps a coffee from a local café savored at a sun-drenched bench, where one can watch the world—and the fog—drift by.
